items.description: The share touched a 52-week high of Rs 369.00 and a 52-week low of Rs 176.05 on 04 July, 2024 and 27 November, 2024, respectively.

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: GIFT Nifty suggests a flat start; US markets fall, Asia trade mixed
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: Wall Street's main indexes closed lower on Tuesday as technology sector losses offset gains in communications services while investors waited for key inflation reports that may influence the Federal Reserve's next interest rate decisions. The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 154.10 points, or 0.35%, to 44,247.83. The S&P 500 lost 17.94 points, or 0.30%, at 6,034.91 and the Nasdaq Composite fell 49.45 points, or 0.25%, to 19,687.24.

items.title: Agri Picks Report December 11, 2024: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit Financial Services, Farmers in Gujarat have sown rabi crops over 2.5 million hectares as of Monday, down 29.4% from 3.6 million hectares a year ago, according to a report released by the state agriculture department.

items.title: Live: Nifty Stuck In A Range; Break Above 24,750 Key To Watch| Cement Firms In Focus| Opening Bell
items.description: Indian benchmark indices ended on a flat note in a highly volatile session on December 10. At close, the Sensex was up 1.59 points at 81,510.05, while the Nifty was down 8.95 points or 0.04 percent at 24,610.05.After a flat to positive start, the market traded in positive territory in the first half. However, profit booking in the second half dragged the Nifty into red. But final-hour buying, especially in the IT, Realty names, erased all the losses to end with little change. This morning global cues are mixed with the GIFT Nifty signalling a muted start. Cement firms will be in focus post price hike. 3 IPOs, Vishal Mega mart, Mobikwik and Sai Life Sciences will open for subscription today. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Rajesh Palviya, Senior Vice President Research (Head Technical & Derivatives ) at Axis Securities and Manoj Bahety, Founder & Fund Manager, Carnelian Asset Management.

items.title: Short Call | Is quick commerce turning into the Street's new darling? Swiggy, Mphasis, Waree Energies in focus
items.description: “The ability to create its own market is the strategic, the dominating, and the single most distinguishing characteristic of a true growth company.”--Peter Bernstein

items.title: Swiggy shares drop 4% amid profit booking after anchor lock-in ends
items.description: Analysts on the Street believe Swiggy has the potential to deliver better returns in the short -term thanks to the upbeat growth prospects of Indian quick commerce and the company's cheaper valuations.

items.title: HG Infra shares soar 5% on new order win worth Rs 763 crore
items.description: HG Infra’s bid for the project is valued at Rs 763.11 crore, against MoRTH's estimated project cost of Rs 898.5 crore. The company aims to complete the construction within two years.

items.title: Ambit retains Zomato as its core holding in Dec, says business model only partly imitable by Swiggy, Zepto
items.description: Zomato has a high average order value in food delivery as well as quick commerce. Competitors who try to copy the business model of Zomato can only partially imitate this, says the asset manager
